intro: Adesmia neuquenensis, commonly known as the Neuquén legume, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is known for its nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Adesmia neuquenensis plays a role in stabilizing soils and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
